website_summaries.verdict: Kids who are into ceramics will love this pottery wheel. The motor isn't the strongest, but it's great for those just learning pottery-throwing techniques.
pros: Thanks to the multi-directional motor, it's suitable for left-handed and right-handed people
Comes with potters' tools, air dry clay, and paint
cons: Some complaints of the motor stalling

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely a "beginners" pottery wheel
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a pretty good very basic "beginner's" pottery wheel -- good mainly as an inexpensive tool for learning the basic techniques such as centering. It has a pretty weak motor though and the wheel can easily stall, but after I replaced the motor with a more powerful one (, the pottery wheel was easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Day

customer_reviews.title: Fun but SUPER NOISY
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wheel and it is working well. My son is enjoying with one exception the noise coming out of this motor is ridiculous. It is so loud we are having to wear noise canceling headphones to use it. I am shocked at how bad it is even after seeing other reviews. It’s deafening. I can’t believe this isn’t fixable. Overall value is good just wish something was better with this motor.
customer_reviews.author: JR H.

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had and used this pottery wheel for a few years. It’s held up nicely. Both my kids love making their own bowls. It has a right hand/left hand feature which allows for opposite rotation which is great for my family of lefties and righties. One tip: if the clay is too dry it’s hard to mold. Wrap it in a damp towel and let it absorb the moisture prior to use and make sure hands are wet or it will cause resistance. We’re happy with this product and are considering another so our kids can work independently together.
customer_reviews.author: CNM

customer_reviews.title: Good Child's Wheel
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old granddaughter had wanted a pottery wheel. After reading the reviews of all the "toy" wheels, I purchased this one. She was able to use it without a problem and made "wonderful' cups and bowls. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Nice arts and crafts toy.
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yr old daughter loves it. Spends hours on it doing arts and crafts. She made many utensils in addition to home made lamps.
customer_reviews.author: mubamemon

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. The pottery wheel is not able to sustain very much pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating to use. The wheel keeps stopping with ordinary pressure. Start and stop. Start and stop. Start and stop. The tool support accessory is impossible to put on the machine and has no directions to figure out how it might be mounted. In fact, this machine comes with very little instructions. I would not recommend this at all. It should be called toy pottery wheel, not pottery wheel for beginners. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Motor is loud, do yourself a favor and do this outside
customer_reviews.text: If your kid loves a mess, likes to get dirty, and does not mind loud noise; this could be the toy for you. You need a LOT of water for the clay to get soft and mold. The motor does get stuck a little. My daughter has used this once since she got it. More because I put away and she has so many other toys. I will try to bring it out again now that it is summer and she can do outside. Must have a good/stable table to set on. Foot pedal could be more substantial for a kid but at least they can learn hand/foot manipulation.
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Peice of crap! broke the second time my daughter used it and she never got to make anything. Don't even waste your money
customer_reviews.author: arion anezis

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bough this for my 12 year old son and it is so loud and it does not turn very well at all it will just stop when you are trying to make stuff and not very power full.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice setup for kids. Too little power to do real work
customer_reviews.author: T.R

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I understand that it's a beginner's wheel. It's made for kids and, of course, can't be as powerful as a professional pottery wheel. However, this product doesn't really work that well. To actually mold the clay you need to press hard and the wheel can't take the pressure--it just stops. I would honestly just buy modeling clay or hand build with regular clay. Save your money and don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is not worth the money you will spend. Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend this to anyone. We purchased this for my daughter as a introduction to Pottery. It broke during the first use. The wheel did not turn properly. We have been trying to return it but have been unsuccessful in doing so. By the time she used it, it was already past the return date. This was very pricey and definitely should have not broken on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: once you try to apply even a small amount of pressure, the wheel stops spinning. it also squeaks loudly. returning it ASAP and I believe any of the positive reviews are fake
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: Great!! No so noisy like everyone says
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I have no idea what everyone else is talking about with the noise!! Lol Yes. It makes noise...it's a pottery wheel!!!! It is not unbearable...if someone is watching something or reading yes don't do it around them. Seems awesome so far! Simple, easy starter wheel!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift for my grandaughter. She made ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandaughter. She made a little bowl with it the very next day and has been enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Tucker

customer_reviews.title: This product is worthless. The power is not strong ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is worthless. The power is not strong enough to mold clay.
customer_reviews.author: Aldrian Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Clay needs to be softened alot in order to mold.
customer_reviews.text: The items the wheel came with were good in use. The wheel spun well and did stop when too much pressure was applied. It has been used twice by my 10 yrs old granddaughter . She says she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: SCulp

customer_reviews.title: WEAK!
customer_reviews.text: Only for kids, and play... very week and spazy wheel. but nice size! I wish i would have selected a diffrent one.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Lobdell

customer_reviews.title: Something new to learn!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters love it, ages 7 and 10. It is actually more functional than I expected, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for grandson, he loved it! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda McVey

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work
customer_reviews.text: I recvd this and the turn table stops doesn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Mills

customer_reviews.title: Foot pedal wont work
customer_reviews.text: The foot pedal was not working. It is in consistant.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Kids bored after five minutes
customer_reviews.text: Seriously why do we, as parents, do this to our kids. Don't buy this. It was fun for about five minutes. There really isn't any good instruction other than an art class for this.
customer_reviews.author: Delina Storm

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great pottery wheel! Our 7 year old was able to get the hang of it right out of the box. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have had so much fun making pottery with my granddaughter. Perfect beginner pottery wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara R.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the paint was dried up and can not use it properly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gift for 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my 9 year old granddaughter. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: SuusTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the reviews I read I expected it to be so much stronger than it was. It is really loud also, that bothered my daughter the most. I am super bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: grandkids love it
customer_reviews.text: wanted something that was not to expensive but still gives a good knowledge of how to use a turn table
customer_reviews.author: M. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: This product is not good. The pieces do not fit where they are ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is not good. The pieces do not fit where they are supposed to and it broke after one try. Additionally, there were not instructions listed in the box once we received it, and pieces were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Diane McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for me for Christmas (when the price was 139... thanks for that amazon) and as thoughtful and amazing as my husband is. He had no idea how cheaply made this wheel was. The pedal is very sensitive (the wires inside have had to be sauntered back on twice now) you also can’t apply much force to your project without fear of breaking it (the sound is nerve racking alone) or it just stops turning... very disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.author: JaymieLyn

customer_reviews.title: Does not turn at all
customer_reviews.text: Looked great and my granddaughter was so excited to use. It would not turn at all. Returned same day as opening.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Adams

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. The clay does not stick to the plastic and any amount of pressure and the clay spins off the wheel. You can’t even make a round chunk of clay.
customer_reviews.author: Aren

product_meta.title: Pottery Wheel For Beginners
feature_bullets: CREATE A CRAFTY SIDE: The Pottery Wheel from MindWare is a wonderful way to introduce children to incredibly fun and beneficial craft of ceramic making.
DOABLE AND DURABLE: This is the STRONGEST and MOST DURABLE pottery wheel available for children, making the process of creating fun throughout.

EXCELLENT FEATURES TO LAST YOU YEARS: Features a safety stop feature prevents the motor from running if too much pressure is applied, helping you learn valuable pottery skills and preventing the motor from overheating.
SHOW YOUR ARTISTIC SIDE: Aside from creating original ceramic creations, this kit from MindWare also includes 12 paints to allow children to fully design their artistic creations
INCLUDES: Pottery wheel with pedal, clay, AC adaptor, five tools, 12 paints, paintbrush, illustrated instructions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars152 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
